ratings.question_text: How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: I did not think some of the earlier reading response assignments were very useful to my interests, but I did find the mid-term and final projects to be very useful.
The professor tailored lectures to both his expertise and the interest of the students in the class.

Professor Khalil is a rare teacher at Yale. He really invests in his students and works to encourage their strengths. He is also very open to feedback about the course and actively seeks input into how the course can be improved. These attributes make the course a very worthwhile endeavor.Professor Khalil has an extensive understanding of both science and management and experience in both academia and industry. He uses these abilities to engage students in a wide breadth of subject areas. I enjoyed the fact that he encouraged us to engage him in topics we were studying in other classes. This helped me to synthesize and integrate what I am learning at FES.
The professor. He is easily one of the most caring and invested professors. He is a great resource if you know what you want to know. It was a pleasure going to class e en on Fridays.
The instructor really worked with each student individually to help us apply environmental risk assessment concepts to our own interests.

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: Class is on Friday afternoon.
It would have been nice to start with the more concrete concepts like fault tree analysisa little earlier.
In the class we covered many ERA tools and it would have been good to have more practice using those tools through homework assignments.

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: Professor Khalil is very earnest about being accessible to students. He is also open to mentoring students if have interests in pursuing research topics in his areas of expertise.Anobha is also very available and open to assisting students. She has a background in environmental health and environmental epi. I feel that was a valuable member of the classroom.
She was kind and responsive.

Both were available. I never went to office hours, but that was because both the instructor and TA were available before and after class to meet with me and the other students. We also communicated through email and the instructor was prompt in responding. The instructor seemed invested in our projects.

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: The course is valuable because of it's interdisciplinary focus. It integrates risk assessment, natural science, and policy.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I was just auditing this course out of interest and relevance to my research project. I am an Environmental Engineering PhD student.
I am interested in risk assessment and toxicology.
Wanted to understand the decision-making process behind risk management and learn a bit of the risk language.
I wanted to learn qualitative and quantitative tools for conducting environmental risk assessments.

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: Yes, this was a great course to supplement my current knowledge on risk assessment. It was great to learn from someone who is an expert and so well known in the field.
Yes. I am very happy that I took the course and would highly recommend it.
Almost. I kind of wish we had more than one class a week. I think we would have benefited from more in class time.

narratives.question_text: Did you get out of it what you expected?
comments: Yes
Yes.
Yes I got a good foundation for the area I want to go into and really enjoyed and hot something out of the final project.
I expected to acquire more analytical skills and I feel like that happened,although I am still not comfortable with all the material the instructor taught.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: I would advise you to start thinking about your research paper early in the course. I would also advise you to meet with Professor Khalil and the TA in order to focus your research interest earlier rather than later.
Ask lots of questions on class material and your own interests.
If you want to get the most out of this class, it is best to engage the professor in your specific interest. That is how he can be most helpful.
